Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Urechistachykinin II (UII, Gly-rich; Ala-rich; natural AMPs; neuropeptide, marine worms, Echiura, invertebrates, animals; XXA)
Sequence Information.Source: edible fat innkeeper worm or the penis fish,Urechis unicinctus

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against Gram+ bacteria S. mutants (MIC 12.7 uM), S. aureus (MIC 25.4 uM), and E. faecium (MIC 25.4 uM) and gram- bacteria E. coli O-157 (MIC 12.7 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 12.7 uM), and V. vulnificus (MIC 25.4 uM) and fungi C. albicans (MIC 25.4 uM), T. beigelii (MIC 12.7 uM), M. furfur (MIC 50.9 uM).Toxicity: zero hemo.lytic at 100 uM (cf. melittin 100% hemolysis at 6.25 uM).MOA:  probably membrane disruption. Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Sung WS, Park SH, Lee DG2008
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial effect and membrane-active mechanism of Urechistachykinins, neuropeptides derived from Urechis unicinctus.
